name: China
sectors: Power (other sectors to be included later)
inclusion_thresholds: Entities with emissions of at least 26,000 tCO2 per year
emissions_cap: ~4,000 MtCO2 per year (2021) - based on sum of allocations of covered entities

name: South Korea
sectors: All sectors with entities above inclusion thresholds (power, industry, buildings, transport, waste and others)
ghgs: CO2, CH4, N2O, HFCs, PFCs & SF6
inclusion_thresholds: Entities with emissions of at least 125,000 tCO2e per year, or with installations having emissions of at least 25,000 tCO2e per year
emissions_cap: 3048 MtCO2 across Phase 3 (5 years, 2021-2025) - absolute cap

name: Japan
sectors: Consumption of fuels, heat and electricity in commercial and industrial buildings
inclusion_thresholds: Facilities consuming energy equivalent to at least 1,500 kl of crude oil per year
emissions_cap: 12 MtCO2 per year (Tokyo, 2020) & 7 Mt CO2 per year (Saitama, 2020) - actual emissions

name: Indonesia
inclusion_thresholds: Power plants with capacity more than 100MW
emissions_cap: ~159 MtCO2 per year  (2021) - based on sum of allocations of covered entities

name: Thailand
note1: A domestic carbon market was called for in the 12th National Economic and Social Development Plan (2017-2021) with details expected to be outlined in the Climate Change Act later in 2021
note2: Since 2013 ETS development has taken place as part of a voluntary ETS
note3: A pilot ETS will be implemented in the Eastern Economic Corridor as part of a strategic plan being developed in 2021

name: Chinese Taipei
note1: The GHG Reduction and Management Act of 2015 signalled Taiwan EPA's intention to implement an ETS
note2: ETS plans are further outlined in Climate Change Action Guideline of 2017 and GHG Reduction Action Plans
note3: Taiwan EPA is currently amending the GHG Act to include details of carbon pricing policy - to be released later in 2021

name: Vietnam
note1: In 2020 a revised Law on Environmental Protection was adopted which mandates the design of a domestic ETS - this law will enter into force in January 2022
note2: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE) is set to establish the ETS
note3: A pilot system is expected to start first, followed by a full system

name: Philippines
note1: A bill including provisions for a cap-and-trade system for industrial and commercial sectors was conditionally approved in 2020
note2: A technical working group has been established to review the bill, which will be reconsidered based on the group's input
